schema.description: Logs out user from all sessions. Under the hood, all tokens are invalidated.

200.description: Successful logout.

get.summary: Retrieve the current system authentication configuration.
get.description: Note that the values returned by the API don't match this object's validation when they've never been set before.

200.description: The call was successful, the returned data is the currentauthentication configuration for the system. If the method is `local` and not `ldap` then the configured LDAP settings are ignored.

204.description: System authentication configuration was successfully updated.

400.description: Invalid configuration data provided / did not validate.

put.summary: **THIS ENDPOINT IS DEPRECATED** use `PATCH /system/auth/config` instead. Set the system authentication configuration.

204.description: System authentication configuration was successfully updated.

400.description: Invalid configuration data provided / did not validate.

post.summary: Test provided system authentication with a username/password or a group name.
post.description:
Test the provided system authentication with the enclosed auth
            configuration, username and password, or a group name. If the data is valid
            against the schema then this will always succeed. The content of the response will
            indicate if an error occurred or the detailed user/group data if the
            authentication was successful. This only works with method `LDAP`, not `LOCAL`.

200.description: Successful Response

400.description: Invalid configuration data provided / did not validate.

get.summary: Get all groups available on LDAP.

parameters.name: filter

schema.description: An optional filter that will be applied to the groups.
schema.title: Filter

parameters.description: An optional filter that will be applied to the groups.

200.description: The call was successful, the returned data is a list of the CNs of available groups.

schema.description: An array of LDAP CNs.
schema.title: Response 200 System Auth Groups System Auth Groups Get

put.summary: Refreshes groups from LDAP.
put.description:
For each LDAP group in CML, tries to refresh the group from the server.
                If the group no longer exists, it is marked as such. Otherwise,
                retrieves current group members from the server and mirrors group memberships in
                locally created LDAP groups and users.

Creates the group specified by request data. Groups can only be
        created by administrators. Otherwise, "Access Denied" is returned.

        deleted by administrators. Certain groups (like the admin group) can
        never be deleted. In both cases, "Access Denied" is returned.

        associated lab API endpoint.

post.summary: Create a lab from the specified topology, specified in the CML2 YAML format.

400.description: Import failed.

post.summary: Create a lab from the specified VIRL v1.x topology file contents.

parameters.name: title

schema.description: The title for the newly created lab. If not provided, the title from the imported file will be used.

parameters.description: The title for the newly created lab. If not provided, the title from the imported file will be used.

requestBody.description: This request body is a VIRL v1.x topology in the XML format defined by the virl.xsd schema.

text/xml.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                        <root> <!-- Your lab as XML content here -->
                        </root>

post.summary: Create one or more interfaces.

schema.description: The unique ID of a lab on this controller.
schema.title: Lab Id

parameters.description: The unique ID of a lab on this controller.

schema.description: A JSON object that specifies a request to create an interface on a node. If the slot is omitted, the request indicates the *first* unused slot on the node. If the slot is specified, the request indicates *all unallocated* slots up to and including that slot.

200.description:
Returns a JSON object that identifies the interface that was created.
                In the case of bulk interface creation, i.e. when slot is set in request
                returns a JSON array of interface objects from slot zero to requested
                slot even if there were already more interfaces present prior to the
                request.

                If slot is unspecified, then a new interface is created and returned.
                This interface will be one after all the current interfaces on the node.

                If the node definition has a minimal count of interfaces, then this minimum
                number of interfaces is created on the node regardless of the slot parameter.
                E.g. if min_count is 4, then the node will have at least 4 interfaces.
                Calling this function twice on a node with no interfaces without the slot
                parameter set will create a total of 5 interfaces and return interface
                with slot 0 (the first of 4 created) and interface with slot 4 (one more
                interface created), respectively.

schema.title: Response 200 Lab Create Interface Labs  Lab Id  Interfaces Post

404.description: Specified lab not found or physical configuration locked.

group_ok.title: Group Ok
group_ok.description: The group exists on the server and the group filter matches.

is_member.title: Is Member
is_member.description: Whether the given user is a member of the given group. Will default to false if either the user or the group could not be found on the LDAP server.

display.title: Display
display.description: The group's display name, if the configured attribute was found.

attributes.description: If the group was found OK, then this object holds the dictionary of group attributes, independent of having CML access or admin access or other privileges. If an error occurred (config/server problem), then the error message will be included in the attributes.

auth_ok.title: Auth Ok
auth_ok.description: The user has access to the system and the user filter matches.

is_admin.title: Is Admin
is_admin.description: The user has admin rights. If LDAP is configured, then the admin filter must match.

display.title: Display
display.description: The user's display name, if the configured attribute was found.

email.title: Email
email.description: The user's email address, if the configured attribute was found.

attributes.description: If the user auth'ed OK, then this object holds the dictionary of user attributes, independent of having CML access or admin access or other privileges. If an error occurred (config/server problem), then the error message will be included in the attributes.

error.title: Error
error.description: Error messages for errors that occurred while authenticating, but did not interrupt the login, such as LDAP group membership refresh errors.
examples: Could not refresh LDAP group memberships (Invalid base DN or root DN format)

status.title: Status
status.description: The current authorization status of this product instance.

expires.title: Expires
expires.description: The time current valid authorization is due to expire.

host_address.title: Host Address
host_address.description: An IPv4 or IPv6 host address.

server_address.title: Server Address
server_address.description: Host address on the internal cluster network.

is_simulator.title: Is Simulator
is_simulator.description: Host is used for virtual machine nodes.

is_connector.title: Is Connector
is_connector.description: Host is used for external connector and unmanaged switch nodes.

admission_state.description: The admission state of the compute host.

nodes.title: Nodes
nodes.description: List of node ID's deployed on the host.

node_counts.description: Count of nodes and orphans deployed and running on the host.

is_connected.title: Is Connected
is_connected.description: Host is communicating with the controller.

is_synced.title: Is Synced
is_synced.description: Host state is synchronized with the controller.

admission_state.description:
Compute host administrative admission state.
    * `UNREGISTERED` - host shall be disconnected by controller before removal.
    * `REGISTERED` - host has been registered (will be switched ready immediately).
    * `ONLINE` - host is part of cluster but does not allow to start nodes.
    * `READY` - host is part of cluster and allowed to start nodes.

cpu.description: CPU statistics that shows number of cpus and load percent

memory.description: Memory statistics of the compute host.

disk.description: Disk statistics of the compute host.

disk.description: Disk statistics of the compute host.

hostname.title: Hostname

is_controller.title: Is Controller

bandwidth.title: Bandwidth
bandwidth.description: Bandwidth of the link in kbps.

latency.title: Latency
latency.description: Delay of the link in ms.

loss.title: Loss
loss.description: Loss of the link in percent.

jitter.title: Jitter
jitter.description: Jitter of the link in ms.

corrupt_prob.title: Corrupt Prob
corrupt_prob.description: Probability of corrupted frames in percent.

enabled.title: Enabled

operational.description: Additional operational data associated with the link conditioning.

name.title: Name

core_connected.title: Core Connected
core_connected.description: Indicates whether core controller is connected

images_loaded.title: Images Loaded
images_loaded.description: Indicates whether image definitions were loaded

valid.title: Valid
valid.description: Indicates whether the controller is in valid state.

anyOf.description: The name of the folder to clone in the repository.

tags.name: Annotations
tags.description: API endpoints dealing with topology annotation elements like rectangles, text, lines and ellipses related to a particular lab ID.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Authentication API endpoints to acquire an Authentication token. The token must be conveyed as a HTTP header. The name of the header is `Authorization` and the content is `Bearer token-goes-here`.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: User related API endpoints like creating or deleting users.

tags.name: Groups
tags.description: Group related API endpoints like creating or updating groups.

tags.name: Labs
tags.description: Lab related API endpoints, including creating new labs and getting the list of all labs.

tags.name: Nodes
tags.description: Node related API endpoints, typically associated to a lab ID (topology). Each node represents a device in such a lab topology, such as a router, switch, firewall, or host.

tags.name: Interfaces
tags.description: API endpoints for the interfaces of nodes in a lab.

tags.name: Links
tags.description: API endpoints for links or connections between nodes in a lab. Links will generally connect at each end to exactly one interface.

tags.name: Runtime
tags.description: API endpoints for working with items that are only exposed by system and topology elements at runtime, such as console connections and packet captures.

tags.name: System
tags.description: API endpoints for the underlying controller software and the host system where it runs.

tags.name: Node definitions
tags.description: API endpoints to manage node definitions. Node definitions define the properties of a virtual network node. They are paired with image definitions to define a complete virtual network node.

tags.name: Metadata
tags.description: API endpoints that work with the metadata of a topology, such as node type definitions and the state of various objects in (running) labs.

tags.name: Image definitions
tags.description: API endpoints dealing with images that are required to boot a virtual network node. Image definitions are coupled with node definitions.

tags.name: Smart Annotations
tags.description: API endpoints dealing with topology smart annotations based on node tags.

tags.name: Resource pools
tags.description: API endpoints related to resource pools, managing limits on resource usage of all nodes started by associated users.

tags.name: Licensing
tags.description: Licensing related API endpoints.

tags.name: PCAP
tags.description: API endpoints for packet captures on links. Starting and stopping a packet capture or downloading a packet capture in PCAP format readable by Wireshark or a single packet of a packet capture.

tags.name: Link conditioning
tags.description: API endpoints related to link conditioning of a link by applying e.g. delay, jitter loss or bandwidth restriction (amongst others) on a link.

tags.name: Telemetry
tags.description: API endpoints for sending telemetry data.

tags.name: Diagnostics
tags.description: API endpoints for retrieving diagnostic information for the back end systems.
